title.rendered: Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey 3: Flow Components

content.rendered:
The Presentation

I was honored be a guest presenter on Automation Hour for the 3rd time in 2018. Within the last year salesforce released the ability to use Lightning Components within Visual Workflow.  This allows for massive amounts of increased functionality, as well as the ability to do smaller amounts of development when the out of the box functionality for Flow needs to be enhanced for your use case, rather than having to build the complete flow as a custom component.  The increased amount of declarative build will give you easier, faster, and more streamlined turn around of your initial build, as well as changes and modifications.  But how do these Flow components work?  What can you use them for?  That’s what we are here to focus on in this webinar.

Resp

The Deck

Recording

jetpack-related-posts.title: Automation Hour 2021: Einstein Bot Flows &  Omni-Channel Routing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Curious about Einstein Bots, Flow, or the new Omni-Channel Routing functionality? In this episode of Automation Hour, you'll learn about AI and all of that inside of Salesforce from Technical Architect & Salesforce MVP, Meighan Brodkey.

img.alt_text: Automation Hour: Flows, Bots, and AI… OH MY!!!

jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Let's talk about flow baby - Part one of the community class on how to for flows

jetpack-related-posts.title: Automation Hour:  Community Users with Flow and Platform Events
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Automation Hour 2019 Forgot UsernameSeptember 2019 Use Case Looking for a declarative way to do a forgot username on communities. No out of the box componentSecurity prevents guests from User Lookup The Presenters Meighan Brodkey Meighan is a technical architect and the leader of the Seattle Women in Tech User Group…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Automation Hour w/ Meighan Brodkey Community Non-Account Based Sharing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Meighan Brodkey presents a great session on Rollup Summary Fields with Lookups. Meighan takes the standard "Rollup" mentality to the next level with dynamic rollups based on what type of record is connected to the record. An awesome scenario that can show you how to take your automation to the…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Ideas
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Salesforce IdeasThe IdeaExchange was designed so that we would have the opportunity to share what we, as the end users of Salesforce, the people that use it everyday, want and need as features and functionality.It's awesome. It's one of the most amazing, dare I even say revolutionary opportunities that we…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Salesforce DevTools
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This tool is fantastic for so many reasons, it's called Salesforce DevTools but really it's for more than just Devs. Use it with Debug Logs (great for working with Process Builder and Flow - not just code), ERD's, Data, queries, exports and more! Once you try it, you'll want to…
